benchmark_details.name: VENUS (VidEo with Nonverbal cues and Utterance Set)
benchmark_details.overview: VENUS is a large-scale multimodal dataset designed for multimodal conversations with nonverbal annotations. It comprises 10-minute clips from dialogue-rich podcasts featuring two-person interactions, along with time-aligned text, facial expressions, and body language.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance research in understanding and generating both text and nonverbal expressions in conversations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The VENUS dataset is primarily curated from one source, which may limit the diversity of nonverbal expression patterns.

data.annotation: Annotations include time-aligned text, 3D facial expression features, and body language features.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the model performance during evaluation.
methodology.interpretation: Lower perplexity and higher BERT Score indicate better performance in generating natural language and nonverbal expressions.
methodology.validation: The dataset and model were validated through extensive evaluation metrics and user studies.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset does not detail demographic factors.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy measures include releasing only video IDs instead of raw video frames and anonymizing 3D facial and body motions.
